items.name: Object_Hotspot
items.content:
# =================================================================== # # Script: Object_Hotspot # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Object_Hotspot extends gs.Object_Visual @objectCodecBlackList = ["parent"] ###* * A hotspot object to define an area on the screen which can respond * to user-actions like mouse/touch actions. A hotspot can have multiple * images for different states like hovered, selected, etc. * * @module gs * @class Object_Hotspot * @extends gs.Object_Visual * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: () -> super ###* * The object's source rectangle. It controls which part of the object's image is used * for visual presentation. * @property srcRect * @type gs.Rect ### @srcRect = new Rect() ###* * The object's mask to execute masking-effects on it. * @property mask * @type gs.Mask ### @mask = new gs.Mask() ###* * Indicates if the object's visual presentation should be mirrored horizontally. * @property mirror * @type boolean ### @mirror = false ###* * The domain the object belongs to. * @property domain * @type string ### @domain = "com.degica.vnm.default" ###* * The object's image used for visual presentation. * @property image * @type string ### @image = "" ###* * The rotation-angle of the picture in degrees. The rotation center depends on the * anchor-point. * @property angle * @type number ### @angle = 0 ###* * The color tone of the object used for the visual presentation. * @property tone * @type gs.Tone ### @tone = new Tone(0, 0, 0, 0) ###* * The color of the object used for the visual presentation. * @property color * @type gs.Color ### @color = new Color(255, 255, 255, 0) ###* * Contains different kinds of effects which can be activated for the object. * @property effects * @type Object ### @effects = new gs.EffectCollection() ###* * Indicates if the hotspot is selectable by mouse/touch. * @property selectable * @type boolean ### @selectable = yes ###* * Indicates if the hotspot is enabled. A disabled hotspot will not fire any events/actions. * @property enabled. * @type boolean ### @enabled = yes ###* * The object's visual-component to display the game object on screen. * @property visual * @type gs.Component_Sprite ### @visual = new gs.Component_Sprite() ###* * The object's image-handling. * @property imageHandling * @type gs.ImageHandling ### @imageHandling = 0 ###* * A behavior-component to hotspot-specific behavior to the object. * @property behavior * @type gs.Component_HotspotBehavior ### @behavior = new gs.Component_HotspotBehavior() @behavior.imageHandling = @imageHandling ###* * The hotspot's target. The target it optional but if set the hotspot follows * the target. For example: A hotspot could be follow moving picture. * @property target * @type gs.Object_Visual ### @target = null ###* * The names of the images for the different states of the hotspot. At least one image * needs to be set. The other ones are optional and used for the following:
* * - 0 = Base (Required) * - 1 = Hovered * - 2 = Unselected * - 3 = Selected * - 4 = Selected Hovered * @property images * @type string[] ### @images = [] ###* * An event-emitter to emit events. * @property events * @type gs.Component_EventEmitter ### @events = new gs.EventEmitter(); @addComponent(@events) @addComponent(@behavior) @addComponent(@visual) gs.Object_Hotspot = Object_Hotspot
